result.execSummary:
The defendant Kayla Marie Gibas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 171 days served.

-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision imposed as to Case# 22CF01676.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge (if not already done so) during the term of extended supervision imposed as to Case# 22CF01676.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds

records.addlTxt:
Plea Hearing was held September 7, 2022.
A review of the plea hearing court record entry does not make reference to the warning as to firearm restriction.
Court finds that a plea hearing was held on October 13 as to Case# 22CF01676 and during that hearing defendant was advised that as a convicted felon she is not allowed to possess any firearms

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Kayla Marie Gibas in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Kayla Marie Gibas.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

Court sentenced defendant to serve  8  MONTHS  in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to any other sentence with credit for  171 days served.  

-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision imposed as to Case# 22CF01676.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge (if not already done so) during the term of extended supervision imposed as to Case# 22CF01676.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Clerk:  jms
Received and Filed. Letter to the court
Case in court for Plea Hearing. Court is situating another matter and unable to hear case. Case is being spun to Judge Franke. Parties notified and sent to room #310, safety building.

Defendant Kayla Marie Gibas in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Kayla Marie Gibas.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing.  Plea hearing proceeded.

AS TO COUNT 1.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in room 310 of the Safety Building. Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and addendum
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 8 pages) commencing 06-07-2022 by Kathleen S. Worden.

OFF RECORD - Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Kayla Marie Gibas not in court, in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a plea hearing. Court authorizes transfer to Judge Shelton for global resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Kayla Marie Gibas in court, appear by video with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent, appear by video.  Defendant Kayla Marie Gibas in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Officer J.Shoman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant.  (Kayla M. Gibas - #2022005196, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Kayla Marie Gibas not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in trial this week.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Kayla Marie Gibas in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Kayla Marie Gibas in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kayla Marie Gibas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Kayla Marie Gibas not in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Initial appearance on March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant called in this afternoon and was not feeling good. She does have a doctor's letter stating that they wanted her to stay home. Court date for 3/14/2022 has been vacated. Case rescheduled. New notice was mailed.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/14/22 @ 2p
